channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Watch: Jimmy Kimmel tears up speaking about 'terrible' election night
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel said it was a bad night for those who voted for Donald Trump; just that they didn't understand it. It was a 'disaster of a night' for Melania, Kimmel said. It was only a good night for Putin, polio and lovable billionaires like Elon Musk, Kimmel said. "I will say something that Trump would never say unless it favoured him.... He won. That doesn't mean we give up and that doesn't mean we storm the Capitol because we don't like the result," Kimmel said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Nostradamus' Allan Licthman blames democracy after failure to predict Trump win
item.description: For over four decades, Lichtman has used his "Keys to the White House" model with striking accuracy, having correctly predicted every presidential winner since 1984. The 77-year-old American University professor believed that Harris would emerge victorious in the 2024 election, convinced by the model's indicators that pointed towards a Democratic win. However, as the results confirmed Trump’s landslide victory, Lichtman found himself caught off-guard, live-streaming his disbelief alongside his son, Sam. The political soothsayer was left pondering what went awry, even joking, “Good thing I’ve nothing on tomorrow. No interviews for me.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk and son X are part of Donald Trump's family photo. Where's Melania?
item.description: ​Elon Musk and his son featuring in the Trump squad seemed interesting to social media users as they observed that it was not a campaign photo -- JD Vance and Usha were not there. Melania was also not there but Elon and his son were there. Elon Musk is not very public about his children but X is an exception as he made several public appearances with X whose full name is X Æ A-Xii. At the Madison Square Garden rally too, X was there with his father.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: America Ferrera is devastated that Kamala Harris lost, will leave US
item.description: "America (Ferrera) is sick that Donald Trump is President again. She is devastated that Kamala lost. She thought the country she lived in was better than that," the report said. "She is going to continue to have a presence in the US for work purposes and to fight for Latinas and women, but she will be overseas for family and to benefit her kids' education," it said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Call Barron': Donald Trump's instruction to staff before approving podcast list
item.description: ​Barron Trump's height is not the only talked about aspect of Donald Trump's youngest son this election season. The 18-year-old became the DeFi visionary of Donald Trump's crypto platform World Liberty Financial during the election campaign. And Trump spoke profusely about how handy Barron came to reach out to the Gen Z audience as Barron is well versed in podcasts and knew which could bring Trump the maximum coverage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk's estranged daughter says she has no future in Trump's US: 'Even if...'
item.description: "I've thought this for a while, but yesterday confirmed it for me. I don't see my future being in the United States. Even if he's only in office for 4 years, even if the anti-trans regulations magically don't happen, the people who willingly voted this in are not going anywhere anytime soon," Elon Musk's estranged daughter Vivian Jenna Wilson posted on Threads.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy's son takes over his Instagram, social media says 'horrible PR'
item.description: Despite the criticism, Diddy’s children have shown steadfast support for him. His adoptive son, Quincy Brown, posted a family photo on Instagram on October 22, 2024, highlighting their unity and belief that the truth would prevail. His caption emphasized their strength as a family during these difficult times.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'None of them dare name Khalistanis': PPC's Bernier slams Trudeau for silence over temple attack
item.description: Canada's right-wing leaders, inspired by recent Republican victories in the US, are challenging Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's policies. Maxime Bernier, leader of the People's Party of Canada, criticizes Trudeau's stance on immigration, climate change, and government spending, urging for a more conservative approach.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indonesia's Mount Laki-laki erupts again, spewing ash 8,000 meters high
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US judge upholds plea deals for alleged 9/11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammed
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘He was too strong’: Passenger attempts to open plane’s emergency door mid-air, see video
item.description: A Copa Airlines flight from Brazil to Panama experienced a harrowing near-disaster when a passenger, armed with a plastic knife, attempted to open the emergency door. Passengers bravely intervened, subduing the man until authorities apprehended him upon landing. The airline commended both the crew and passengers for their quick action in ensuring the safety of everyone on board.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Rafael makes landfall in Cuba as a 'life-threatening' category 3 storm
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrats blame Joe Biden for Kamala Harris’ massive defeat in US elections
item.description: Kamala Harris lost the US election to Donald Trump, marking the second time Democrats lost to him. Biden's late withdrawal from the race due to health concerns and Harris's alignment with his policies are cited as contributing factors to the loss. The Democrats now face calls for introspection and change within the party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sundar Pichai to Satya Nadella: How prominent Indian-Americans reacted to Trump’s win
item.description: Several prominent Indian-Americans congratulated Donald Trump on his re-election as US President. They expressed their eagerness to collaborate with his administration in strengthening US-India relations and advancing shared global interests. Figures like Vivek Ramaswamy, Sunder Pichai, and Satya Nadella were among those who publicly conveyed their well-wishes and support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump Media gains post-election, even as Truth Social parent reports $19 million quarterly loss
item.description: Trump Media, the parent company of Truth Social, reported a loss of USD 19.2 million in the last quarter. The company attributed the loss to legal fees and declining revenue. Despite the financial struggles, the company's stock price surged following Trump's presidential win.

item.title: German govt in crisis as Scholz’s ruling coalition collapses: All you need to know
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz dismissed Finance Minister Christian Lindner, leading to the collapse of the ruling coalition. Scholz cited policy clashes and plans to seek a vote of confidence in January, potentially triggering early elections amid economic concerns and global uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Our point of view won't always win’: Obama congratulates Trump after win
item.description: Former President Barack Obama congratulated Trump and Vance on their victory while acknowledging the disappointment of those hoping for a different outcome. He emphasized the importance of a peaceful transfer of power and urged Americans to address challenges with unity and grace. Vice president Harris also conceded, promising to continue fighting for the causes her campaign championed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Congratulations pour in, except from Russia
item.description: World leaders reacted to Donald Trump's election victory with a mix of caution and optimism. While some expressed hope for improved relations, others emphasized the need for unity and coordination in the face of potential challenges posed by Trump's policies.

item.title: Bibi's firing of Israel defence chief draws both ire & praise
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's dismissal of Defense Minister Yoav Gallant has ignited controversy and protests across Israel. Gallant's opposition to Netanyahu's handling of the Hamas war, particularly regarding a ceasefire and the Orthodox military exemption issue, led to his removal. Critics accuse Netanyahu of prioritizing political survival over national security, while supporters argue the move brings stability.

item.title: Trump's erratic foreign policy set to meet 'a world on fire'
item.description: As Donald Trump returns to the political stage, questions arise about his foreign policy plans. Supporters believe his strong personality will influence world leaders, while critics point to his past inconsistencies. Trump's approach to the Ukraine war, his support for Israel, and his stance on China will be closely watched.
